stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Phishing Email with Information Fusion Centre Theme Contains Poison Ivy Malware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 12 March 2015, a phishing email was sent from bichthuykz09@gmail.com to a US Government Department with the subject "IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15". The email included the malicious attachment "IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15.doc" (MD5: 016D7C88D39111293B060E65F49CAE3D), which contained an exploit for vulnerability CVE-2012-0158 and Poison Ivy malware. The malware attempts to connect to the command and control domain babyolo.my03.com.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: ---- START EMAIL HEADER ---- EHLO mail-wi0-f169.google.com MAIL FROM:<bichthuykz09@gmail.com> SIZE=158958 RCPT TO:[REDACTED] DATA Received: by wiwh11 with SMTP id h11so16437716wiw.5 for [REDACTED]; Wed, 11 Mar 2015 18:59:36 -0700 (PDT) DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=gmail.com; s=20120113; h=mime-version:date:message-id:subject:from:to:content-type; bh=fCaD2hoT6kWYQKYvQaVS6dPCSXHB82Ke1+rfoKNqO2k=;  MIME-Version: 1.0 X-Received: by 10.194.11.9 with SMTP id m9mr81426656wjb.82.1426125576466; Wed, 11 Mar 2015 18:59:36 -0700 (PDT) Received: by 10.194.221.226 with HTTP; Wed, 11 Mar 2015 18:59:36 -0700 (PDT) Date: Thu, 12 Mar 2015 09:59:36 +0800 Message-ID: <CAJtF1gmU=Xt-BXXGDmjCkMG4JnN4O9iR--BoP5=_-Jf4eAEr2w@mail.gmail.com> Subject: IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15 From: [REDACTED] <bichthuykz09@gmail.com> To: [REDACTED] Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary=047d7b5d22b064142805110dbc04 Bcc: [REDACTED] --047d7b5d22b064142805110dbc04 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=047d7b5d22b064142105110dbc02 --047d7b5d22b064142105110dbc02 Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 ----- END EMAIL HEADER ----- ----- BEGIN EMAIL BODY ----- Dear Sir/Ma'am, Attached is the IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15. Best Regards, Duty Officer Information Fusion Centre [REDACTED EMAIL] [REDACTED SIGNATURE BLOCK] ---- END EMAIL BODY ----

This is a malicious MS Word compatible document. This file is a WebArchive (MIME encoded) in Web page format. It contains an exploit for the vulnerability described in CVE-2012-0158 and installs a Poison Ivy implant file.
When opened in MS Word , it creates two more files:
C:\Documents and Settings\[User]\Application Data\Microsoft\SystemCertificates\SystemCertificates.ocx (MD5: AF797D920FDA253B27F48941A30664BB)
%temp%\SystemCertificates.ocx (MD5: E09D418747B27929E39918A00FED743D)

Path: %temp%\IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15-.doc Type: Composite Document File V2 Document (OLE2) Author: Windows (u7b FIB Timestamp: 11/03/2015 00:58:36; FIB Language ID (far east): 'Chinese (PRC)'
This decoy file is padded with null bytes (0x00) to make it the same size as "IFC Weekly Report 4 Mar - 11 Mar 15.doc" (MD5: B5FBB3DB653DFD01655DCC7C4B221B96).
This file contains the "SimSun" font and a seven-column by four-row table with text "~#$!"

This file is a Microsoft Word document in OLE format (Chinese). It is the same file as MD5: e09d418747b27929e39918a00fed743d with additional null bytes for padding to make the file the same size as MD5: 016D7C88D39111293B060E65F49CAE3D.

This file is a Poison Ivy Implant DLL executed with rundll32 with main export SSSS. This malware is also known as poison.dll, Poison Ivy Implant DLL (TECHNIQUE_Function_2). It poses as a system OCX ActiveX object class file with XOR obfuscation key = 0x00, implant version 2.3.1. CONNECTION SETTINGS Poison Ivy controllers to connect to: Type: DIRECT Port: 53 Dns: "babyolo.my03.com" Type: DIRECT Port: 7433 Dns: "babyolo.my03.com" Type: DIRECT Port: 53 Dns: "babyolo.my03.com" ID: "WLQS" Group: "150311" Password: "admin" INSTALL SETTINGS Startup: No Melt File: Yes ADVANCED SETTINGS Process Mutex: "(V!hex67)" Key Logger: No NETWORK ACTIVITY DNS Request: babyolo.my03.com Strings from dehex 0x93 ws2_32 cks=u ttp= cks= CONNECT %s:%i HTTP/1.0 QSRW ?503 200 thj@h VSWRQ YZ_[^ YZ_[^ QVlM 6I*h<8 ^-m-m<|<|<|M o/o/ {9999
